00126 sub renderProblem {
00127     my $self = shift;
00128     my $rh = shift;

00130 ###########################################
00131 # Grab the course name, if this request is going to depend on 
00132 # some course other than the default course
00133 ###########################################
00134     my $courseName;
00135     my $ce;
00136     my $db;
00137     my $user;
00138     my $beginTime = new Benchmark;
00139 #   if (defined($self->{courseName}) and $self->{courseName} ) {
00140 #       $courseName = $self->{courseName};
00141 #   } elsif (defined($rh->{course}) and $rh->{course}=~/\S/ ) {
00142 #       $courseName = $rh->{course};
00143 #   } else {
00144 #       $courseName = $COURSENAME;
00145 #       # use the default $ce
00146 #   }

00148         $courseName = $self->{courseName};
00149     } 
00150     
00151     # It's better not to get the course in too many places. :-)
00152     # High level information about the course should come from $self
00153     # Lower level information should come from $rh (i.e. passed by $in at WebworkWebservice)
00154     
00155     #FIXME  put in check to make sure the course exists.
00156     eval {
00157         $ce           = WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment->new({webwork_dir=>$WW_DIRECTORY, courseName=> $courseName});
00158         $ce->{apache_root_url}= $HOSTURL;
00159     # Create database object for this course
00160         $db = WeBWorK::DB->new($ce->{dbLayout});
00161     };
00162     # $ce->{pg}->{options}->{catchWarnings}=1;  #FIXME warnings aren't automatically caught 
00163     # when using xmlrpc -- turn this on in the daemon2_course.
00164     #^FIXME  need better way of determining whether the course actually exists.
00165     
00166     # The UNIT_TEST_ON snippets are the closest thing we have to a real unit test.
00167     #
00168     warn "Unable to create course $courseName. Error: $@" if $@;
00169     # my $user = $rh->{user};
00170     #   $user    = 'practice1' unless defined $user and $user =~/\S/;
00171 
00172     my $user = $self->{user_id};
00173     
00174 ###########################################
00175 # Authenticate this request -- done by initiate  in WebworkWebservice 
00176 ###########################################
00177 
00178 
00179 
00180 ###########################################
00181 # Determine the authorization level (permissions)  -- done by initiate  in WebworkWebservice 
00182 ###########################################
00183 
00184 ###############################################################################
00185 # set up warning handler
00186 ###############################################################################
00187     my $warning_messages="";
00188 
00189     my  $warning_handler = sub {
00190             my ($warning) = @_;
00191             CORE::warn $warning;
00192             chomp $warning;
00193             $warning_messages .="$warning\n";           
00194         };
00195 
00196     local $SIG{__WARN__} = $warning_handler;
00197

00202 ###########################################

00206     #   source_from_source_file_path

00211     #   data_from_course
00212     #   data_from_request

00214 ###########################################
00215 # Determine an effective user for this interaction
00216 # or create one if it is not given
00217 # In order:  use effectiveUserName, studentLogin, or user  or 'foobar'
00218 ###########################################
00219     my $effectiveUserName;
00220     if (defined($rh->{effectiveUser}) and $rh->{effectiveUser}=~/\S/ ) {
00221         $effectiveUserName = $rh->{effectiveUser};
00222     } elsif (defined($rh->{envir}->{studentLogin}) and $rh->{envir}->{studentLogin}=~/\S/ ) {
00223         $effectiveUserName = $rh->{envir}->{studentLogin};
00224     } elsif (defined($user) and $user =~ /\S/ ) {
00225         $effectiveUserName = $user;
00226     } else {
00227         $effectiveUserName = 'foobar';
00228     }
00229     ##################################################
00230     if ($UNIT_TESTS_ON) {
00231         print STDERR "RenderProblem.pm:  user = $user\n";
00232         print STDERR "RenderProblem.pm:  courseName = $courseName\n";
00233         print STDERR "RenderProblem.pm:  effectiveUserName = $effectiveUserName\n";
00234     }
00235     
00236     #################################################################
00237     # The effectiveUser is the student the this problem version was written for
00238     # The user might also be the effective user but it could be 
00239     # an instructor checking out how well the problem is working.
00240     #################################################################
00241     
00242     my $effectiveUser = $db->getUser($effectiveUserName); # checked
00243     my $effectiveUserPermissionLevel;
00244     my $effectiveUserPassword;
00245     unless (defined $effectiveUser ) {
00246         $effectiveUser                = $db->newUser;
00247         $effectiveUserPermissionLevel = $db->newPermissionLevel;
00248         $effectiveUserPassword        = $db->newPassword;
00249         $effectiveUser->user_id($effectiveUserName);
00250         $effectiveUserPermissionLevel->user_id($effectiveUserName);
00251         $effectiveUserPassword->user_id($effectiveUserName);
00252         $effectiveUserPassword->password('');
00253         $effectiveUser->last_name($rh->{envir}->{studentName}|| 'foobar');
00254         $effectiveUser->first_name('');
00255         $effectiveUser->student_id($rh->{envir}->{studentID}|| 'foobar');
00256         $effectiveUser->email_address($rh->{envir}->{email}|| '');
00257         $effectiveUser->section($rh->{envir}->{section} ||'');
00258         $effectiveUser->recitation($rh->{envir}->{recitation} ||'');
00259         $effectiveUser->comment('');
00260         $effectiveUser->status('C');
00261         #$effectiveUser->password($rh->{envir}->{studentID}|| 'foobar'); dunno what's going on here
00262         $effectiveUserPermissionLevel->permission(0);
00263     }       
00264    #FIXME  these will fail if the keys are not defined within the environment.
00265 
00266 ###########################################
00267 # Insure that set and problem are defined
00268 # Define the set and problem information from
00269 # data in the environment if necessary
00270 ###########################################
00271     # determine the set name and the set problem number
00272     my $setName       =  (defined($rh->{envir}->{setNumber}) )    ? $rh->{envir}->{setNumber}    : '';
00273     my $problemNumber =  (defined($rh->{envir}->{probNum})   )    ? $rh->{envir}->{probNum}      : 1 ;
00274     my $problemSeed   =  (defined($rh->{envir}->{problemSeed}))   ? $rh->{envir}->{problemSeed}  : 1 ;
00275     my $psvn          =  (defined($rh->{envir}->{psvn})      )    ? $rh->{envir}->{psvn}         : 1234 ;
00276     my $problemStatus =  $rh->{problem_state}->{recorded_score}|| 0 ;
00277     my $problemValue  =  (defined($rh->{envir}->{problemValue}))   ? $rh->{envir}->{problemValue}  : 1 ;
00278     my $num_correct   =  $rh->{problem_state}->{num_correct}   || 0 ;
00279     my $num_incorrect =  $rh->{problem_state}->{num_incorrect} || 0 ;
00280     my $problemAttempted = ($num_correct || $num_incorrect);
00281     my $lastAnswer    = '';
00282     
00283     my $setRecord = $db->getMergedSet($effectiveUserName, $setName);
00284     unless (defined($setRecord) and ref($setRecord) ) {
00285         # if a User Set does not exist for this user and this set
00286         # then we check the Global Set
00287         # if that does not exist we create a fake set
00288         # if it does, we add fake user data
00289         my $userSetClass = $db->{set_user}->{record};
00290         my $globalSet = $db->getGlobalSet($setName); # checked
00291 
00292         if (not defined $globalSet) {
00293             $setRecord = fake_set($db);
00294         } else {
00295             $setRecord = global2user($userSetClass, $globalSet);
00296         }
00297         # initializations
00298         $setRecord->set_id($setName);
00299         $setRecord->set_header("");
00300         $setRecord->hardcopy_header("defaultHeader");
00301         $setRecord->open_date(time()-60*60*24*7); #  one week ago
00302         $setRecord->due_date(time()+60*60*24*7*2); # in two weeks
00303         $setRecord->answer_date(time()+60*60*24*7*3); # in three weeks
00304         $setRecord->psvn($rh->{envir}->{psvn}||0);
00305     }
00306     #warn "set Record is $setRecord";
00307     # obtain the merged problem for $effectiveUser
00308     my $problemRecord = $db->getMergedProblem($effectiveUserName, $setName, $problemNumber); 
00309     
00310     # if that is not yet defined obtain the global problem,
00311     # convert it to a user problem, and add fake user data
00312     unless (defined $problemRecord) {
00313         my $userProblemClass = $db->{problem_user}->{record};
00314         my $globalProblem = $db->getGlobalProblem($setName, $problemNumber); # checked
00315         # if the global problem doesn't exist either, bail!
00316         if(not defined $globalProblem) {
00317             $problemRecord = fake_problem($db);
00318         } else {
00319             $problemRecord = global2user($userProblemClass, $globalProblem);
00320         }
00321         # initializations
00322         $problemRecord->user_id($effectiveUserName);
00323         $problemRecord->problem_id($problemNumber);
00324         $problemRecord->set_id($setName);
00325         $problemRecord->problem_seed($problemSeed);
00326         $problemRecord->status($problemStatus);
00327         $problemRecord->value($problemValue);
00328         $problemRecord->attempted($problemAttempted);
00329         $problemRecord->last_answer($lastAnswer);
00330         $problemRecord->num_correct($num_correct);
00331         $problemRecord->num_incorrect($num_incorrect);
00332     }
00333     # initialize problem source
00334     my $problem_source;
00335     my $r_problem_source =undef;
00336     if (defined($rh->{source})) {
00337         $problem_source = decode_base64($rh->{source});
00338         $problem_source =~ tr /\r/\n/;
00339         $r_problem_source =\$problem_source;
00340         $problemRecord->source_file($rh->{envir}->{fileName}) if defined $rh->{envir}->{fileName};
00341     } elsif (defined($rh->{sourceFilePath}) and $rh->{sourceFilePath} =/\S/)  {
00342         $problemRecord->source_file($rh->{sourceFilePath});
00343     }
00344     $problemRecord->source_file('foobar') unless defined($problemRecord->source_file);
00345     if ($UNIT_TESTS_ON){
00346             print STDERR "RenderProblem.pm: source file is ", $problemRecord->source_file,"\n";
00347             print STDERR "RenderProblem.pm: problem source is included in the request \n" if defined($rh->{source});
00348     }
00349     #warn "problem Record is $problemRecord";
00350     # now we're sure we have valid UserSet and UserProblem objects
00351     # yay!
00352 
00353 ##################################################
00354 # Other initializations
00355 ##################################################
00356     my $translationOptions = {
00357         displayMode     => $rh->{envir}->{displayMode},
00358         showHints       => $rh->{envir}->{showHints},
00359         showSolutions   => $rh->{envir}->{showSolutions},
00360         refreshMath2img => $rh->{envir}->{showHints} || $rh->{envir}->{showSolutions},
00361         processAnswers  => 1,
00362         catchWarnings   => 1,
00363         # methods for supplying the source, 
00364         r_source        => $r_problem_source, # reference to a source file string.
00365         # if reference is not defined then the path is obtained 
00366         # from the problem object.
00367         permissionLevel => $rh->{envir}->{permissionLevel} || 0,
00368     };
00369     
00370     my $formFields = $rh->{envir}->{inputs_ref};
00371     my $key        = $rh->{envir}->{key} || '';
00372     
00373     
00374     #check definitions
00375     #warn "setRecord is ", WebworkWebservice::pretty_print_rh($setRecord);
00376     #warn "problemRecord is",WebworkWebservice::pretty_print_rh($problemRecord);
00377 #   warn "envir is\n ",WebworkWebservice::pretty_print_rh(__PACKAGE__->defineProblemEnvir(
00378 #       $ce,
00379 #       $effectiveUser,
00380 #       $key,
00381 #       $setRecord,
00382 #       $problemRecord,
00383 #       $psvn,  #FIXME -- not used
00384 #       $formFields,
00385 #       $translationOptions,
00386 #   ));
00387 #################################################
00388 
00389 # Other options can be over ridden by modifying 
00390 # $ce->{pg}
00391 
00392 
00393 
00394 # We'll try to use this code instead so that Local does all of the work.
00395 # Most of the configuration will take place in the fake course associated
00396 # with XMLRPC responses
00397 #   problem needs to be loaded with the following:
00398 #       source_file
00399 #       status
00400 #       num_correct
00401 #       num_incorrect
00402 #   it doesn't seem that $effectiveUser, $set or $key is used in the subroutine
00403 #   except that it is passed on to defineProblemEnvironment
00404 
00405     my $pg;
00406     $pg = WebworkWebservice::RenderProblem->new(
00407         $ce,
00408         $effectiveUser,
00409         $key,
00410         $setRecord,
00411         $problemRecord,
00412         $setRecord->psvn, # FIXME: this field should be removed

00414         # translation options
00415         $translationOptions,
00416 #       { # extras
00417 #               overrides       => $rh->{overrides}},
00418 #         }
00419         
00420     );
00421   
00422     my $internal_debug_messages;
00423     if (ref ($pg->{pgcore}) ) {
00424         $internal_debug_messages = $pg->{pgcore}->get_internal_debug_messages;
00425     } else {
00426         $internal_debug_messages = ['Error in obtaining debug messages from PGcore'];
00427     }
00428     # new version of output:
00429     my $out2   = {
00430         text                        => encode_base64( $pg->{body_text}  ),
00431         header_text                 => encode_base64( $pg->{head_text} ),
00432         answers                     => $pg->{answers},
00433         errors                      => $pg->{errors},
00434         WARNINGS                    => encode_base64( 
00435                                          "WARNINGS\n".$warning_messages."\nMore\n".$pg->{warnings} 
00436                                        ),
00437         problem_result              => $pg->{result},
00438         problem_state               => $pg->{state},
00439         flags                       => $pg->{flags},
00440         internal_debug_messages     => $internal_debug_messages,
00441     };
00442     
00443     # Filter out bad reference types
00444     ###################
00445     # DEBUGGING CODE
00446     ###################
00447     if ($debugXmlCode) {
00448         my $logDirectory =$ce->{courseDirs}->{logs};
00449         my $xmlDebugLog  = "$logDirectory/xml_debug.txt";
00450         #warn "RenderProblem.pm: Opening debug log $xmlDebugLog\n" ;
00451         open (DEBUGCODE, ">>$xmlDebugLog") || die "Can't open debug log $xmlDebugLog";
00452         print DEBUGCODE "\n\nStart xml encoding\n";
00453     }
00454     
00455     $out2->{answers} = xml_filter($out2->{answers}); # check this -- it might not be working correctly
00456     ##################
00457     close(DEBUGCODE) if $debugXmlCode;
00458     ###################
00459     
00460     $out2->{flags}->{PROBLEM_GRADER_TO_USE} = undef;
00461     my $endTime = new Benchmark;
00462     $out2->{compute_time} = logTimingInfo($beginTime, $endTime);
00463     # warn "flags are" , WebworkWebservice::pretty_print_rh($pg->{flags});
00464     
00465     $out2;
00466              
00467 }
00468 
00469 #  insures proper conversion to xml structure.
00470 sub xml_filter {
00471     my $input = shift;
00472     my $level = shift || 0;
00473     my $space="  ";
00474     # Hack to filter out CODE references
00475     my $type = ref($input);
00476     if (!defined($type) or !$type ) {
00477         print DEBUGCODE $space x $level." : scalar -- not converted\n" if $debugXmlCode;
00478     } elsif( $type =~/HASH/i or "$input"=~/HASH/i) {
00479         print DEBUGCODE "HASH reference with ".%{$input}." elements will be investigated\n" if $debugXmlCode;
00480         $level++;
00481         foreach my $item (keys %{$input}) {
00482             print DEBUGCODE "  "x$level."$item is " if $debugXmlCode;
00483             $input->{$item} = xml_filter($input->{$item},$level);   
00484         }
00485         $level--;
00486         print DEBUGCODE "  "x$level."HASH reference completed \n" if $debugXmlCode;
00487     } elsif( $type=~/ARRAY/i or "$input"=~/ARRAY/i) {
00488         print DEBUGCODE "  "x$level."ARRAY reference with ".@{$input}." elements will be investigated\n" if $debugXmlCode;
00489         $level++;
00490         my $tmp = [];
00491         foreach my $item (@{$input}) {
00492             $item = xml_filter($item,$level);
00493             push @$tmp, $item;
00494         }
00495         $input = $tmp;
00496         $level--;
00497         print DEBUGCODE "  "x$level."ARRAY reference completed",join(" ",@$input),"\n" if $debugXmlCode;
00498     } elsif($type =~ /CODE/i or "$input" =~/CODE/i) {
00499         $input = "CODE reference";
00500         print DEBUGCODE "  "x$level."CODE reference, converted $input\n" if $debugXmlCode;
00501     } else {
00502         print DEBUGCODE  "  "x$level." $type and was  converted to string\n" if $debugXmlCode;
00503         $input = "$type reference";
00504     }
00505     $input;
00506     
00507 }
00508 
00509 
00510 sub logTimingInfo{
00511     my ($beginTime,$endTime,) = @_;
00512     my $out = "";
00513     $out .= Benchmark::timestr( Benchmark::timediff($endTime , $beginTime) );
00514     $out;
00515 }

00518 ######################################################################
00519 sub new {
00520     shift; # throw away invocant -- we don't need it
00521     my ($ce, $user, $key, $set, $problem, $psvn, $formFields,
00522         $translationOptions) = @_;
00523     
00524     #my $renderer = 'WeBWorK::PG::Local';
00525     my $renderer = $ce->{pg}->{renderer};
00526     
00527     runtime_use $renderer;
00528     # the idea is to have Local call back to the defineProblemEnvir below.
00529     #return WeBWorK::PG::Local::new($renderer,@_);
00530     return $renderer->new(@_);
00531 }

00555 #   ) = @_;
00556 #   
00557 #   my %envir;
00558 #   
00559 #   # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00560 #   
00561 #   # PG environment variables
00562 #   # from docs/pglanguage/pgreference/environmentvariables as of 06/25/2002
00563 #   # any changes are noted by "ADDED:" or "REMOVED:"
